standard.name: SOC 2 Trust Services Criteria
standard.description: SOC 2 (System and Organization Controls 2) is a framework developed by the AICPA for managing customer data based on five Trust Services Criteria: Security, Availability, Processing Integrity, Confidentiality, and Privacy.

controls.name: COSO Principle 1: Integrity and Ethical Values
controls.description: The entity demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values.

controls.name: COSO Principle 2: Board Independence and Oversight
controls.description: The board of directors demonstrates independence from management and exercises oversight of internal control.

controls.name: COSO Principle 3: Management Structure and Authority
controls.description: Management establishes structures, reporting lines, and appropriate authorities and responsibilities.

controls.name: COSO Principle 4: Commitment to Competence
controls.description: The entity demonstrates a commitment to attract, develop, and retain competent individuals.

controls.name: COSO Principle 5: Accountability
controls.description: The entity holds individuals accountable for their internal control responsibilities.

controls.name: COSO Principle 13: Quality Information
controls.description: The entity obtains or generates and uses relevant, quality information to support the functioning of internal control.

controls.name: COSO Principle 14: Internal Communication
controls.description: The entity internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control.

controls.name: COSO Principle 15: External Communication
controls.description: The entity communicates with external parties regarding matters affecting the functioning of internal control.

controls.name: COSO Principle 6: Risk Objectives
controls.description: The entity specifies objectives with sufficient clarity to enable the identification and assessment of risks.

controls.name: COSO Principle 7: Risk Identification and Analysis
controls.description: The entity identifies risks to the achievement of its objectives and analyzes risks to determine how risks should be managed.

controls.name: COSO Principle 8: Fraud Risk
controls.description: The entity considers the potential for fraud in assessing risks to the achievement of objectives.

controls.name: COSO Principle 9: Change Management Risk
controls.description: The entity identifies and assesses changes that could significantly impact the system of internal control.

controls.name: COSO Principle 16: Ongoing and Separate Evaluations
controls.description: The entity selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether controls are present and functioning.

controls.name: COSO Principle 17: Communication of Deficiencies
controls.description: The entity evaluates and communicates internal control deficiencies in a timely manner.

controls.name: COSO Principle 10: Control Activity Selection
controls.description: The entity selects and develops control activities that contribute to the mitigation of risks.

controls.name: COSO Principle 11: Technology General Controls
controls.description: The entity selects and develops general control activities over technology to support the achievement of objectives.

controls.name: COSO Principle 12: Control Deployment through Policies
controls.description: The entity deploys control activities through policies that establish expectations and procedures.

controls.name: Logical and Physical Access - Security Software
controls.description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures to protect information assets.

controls.name: Logical and Physical Access - User Registration
controls.description: Prior to issuing system credentials, the entity registers and authorizes new users.

controls.name: Logical and Physical Access - User Removal
controls.description: The entity authorizes, modifies, or removes access based on roles, responsibilities, or the system use.

controls.name: Logical and Physical Access - Physical Access Restrictions
controls.description: The entity restricts physical access to facilities and protected information assets.

controls.name: Logical and Physical Access - Asset Disposal
controls.description: The entity discontinues logical and physical protections over assets only after their ability to protect data is no longer needed.

controls.name: Logical and Physical Access - External Threats
controls.description: The entity implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon unauthorized logical access or physical access.

controls.name: Logical and Physical Access - Data Transmission
controls.description: The entity restricts the transmission, movement, and removal of information to authorized parties.

controls.name: Logical and Physical Access - Malware Prevention
controls.description: The entity implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon the introduction of malicious software.

controls.name: System Operations - Configuration Management
controls.description: To meet its objectives, the entity uses detection and monitoring procedures to identify changes to configurations.

controls.name: System Operations - Security Event Monitoring
controls.description: The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components for anomalies and security events.

controls.name: System Operations - Event Evaluation
controls.description: The entity evaluates security events to determine whether they could or have resulted in a breach.

controls.name: System Operations - Incident Response
controls.description: The entity responds to identified security incidents by executing a defined incident response program.

controls.name: System Operations - Incident Recovery
controls.description: The entity identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover from identified security incidents.

controls.name: Change Management - Infrastructure and Software Changes
controls.description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops, configures, documents, tests, approves, and implements changes to infrastructure and software.

controls.name: Risk Mitigation - Business Disruption
controls.description: The entity identifies, selects, and develops risk mitigation activities for risks arising from potential business disruptions.

controls.name: Risk Mitigation - Vendor Risk Management
controls.description: The entity assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.

controls.name: Availability - Capacity Management
controls.description: The entity maintains, monitors, and evaluates current processing capacity and use to meet availability commitments.

controls.name: Availability - Environmental Protections
controls.description: The entity authorizes, designs, and implements environmental protections, software, and data backup processes.

controls.name: Availability - Recovery Testing
controls.description: The entity tests recovery plan procedures supporting system recovery to meet its availability commitments.

controls.name: Processing Integrity - Data Quality
controls.description: The entity implements policies and procedures over system inputs to ensure they are complete, accurate, and timely.

controls.name: Processing Integrity - Processing Accuracy
controls.description: The entity implements policies and procedures over system processing to ensure processing is complete, accurate, and timely.

controls.name: Processing Integrity - Output Completeness
controls.description: The entity implements policies and procedures to ensure system outputs are complete, accurate, and distributed only to intended recipients.

controls.name: Processing Integrity - Error Handling
controls.description: The entity implements policies and procedures to detect, record, and resolve processing errors in a timely manner.

controls.name: Processing Integrity - Data Retention
controls.description: The entity implements policies and procedures to store inputs, items in processing, and outputs completely and accurately.

controls.name: Confidentiality - Identification
controls.description: The entity identifies and maintains confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

controls.name: Confidentiality - Disposal
controls.description: The entity disposes of confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

controls.name: Privacy - Notice
controls.description: The entity provides notice to data subjects about its privacy practices to meet its privacy commitments.

controls.name: Privacy - Choice and Consent
controls.description: The entity communicates choices available regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information.

controls.name: Privacy - Collection
controls.description: The entity collects personal information consistent with the entity's privacy commitments and objectives.

controls.name: Privacy - Explicit Consent
controls.description: For information requiring explicit consent, the entity communicates the need for such consent and the consequences of denial.

controls.name: Privacy - Use and Retention
controls.description: The entity limits the use of personal information to the purposes identified and for which consent was obtained.

controls.name: Privacy - Retention Period
controls.description: The entity retains personal information consistent with the entity's objectives related to privacy.

controls.name: Privacy - Secure Disposal
controls.description: The entity securely disposes of personal information to meet the entity's objectives related to privacy.

controls.name: Privacy - Access
controls.description: The entity grants identified and authenticated data subjects the ability to access their stored personal information.

controls.name: Privacy - Correction
controls.description: The entity corrects, amends, or appends personal information based on information provided by data subjects.

controls.name: Privacy - Disclosure to Third Parties
controls.description: The entity discloses personal information to third parties only for purposes identified in the privacy notice.

controls.name: Privacy - Third Party Notification
controls.description: The entity notifies third parties who have received personal information from the entity of changes or data subject requests.

controls.name: Privacy - New Purposes and Uses
controls.description: The entity creates and retains a record of authorized disclosures of personal information.

controls.name: Privacy - Misuse by Third Parties
controls.description: The entity obtains commitments from third parties that they will comply with privacy requirements.

controls.name: Privacy - Third Party Compliance
controls.description: The entity obtains assurances that third parties comply with privacy requirements through contractual agreements.

controls.name: Privacy - Notification of Disclosure
controls.description: The entity provides notification to affected data subjects of authorized disclosures of personal information.

controls.name: Privacy - Unauthorized Disclosure
controls.description: The entity provides notification to affected data subjects, regulators, and others regarding unauthorized access.

controls.name: Privacy - Data Quality
controls.description: The entity collects and maintains accurate, up-to-date, complete, and relevant personal information.

controls.name: Privacy - Complaint Management
controls.description: The entity implements a process for receiving, addressing, resolving, and communicating complaints regarding privacy.
